questions.question: What are dart defines used for in Flutter?
answers: To store compile-time constants without hardcoding them in the source code
To store compile-time constants that affect your Dart code only
To store compile-time constants that affect both your Dart code and native platform code
To securely store encrypted data on device

questions.question: Which mixin is used to synchronize the UI with the refresh rate of the device?
answers: AutomaticKeepAliveClientMixin
SingleTickerProviderStateMixin
ViewportElementMixin
RestorationMixin

questions.question: What are common usages of the BuildContext in Flutter?
answers: To access ancestor widgets in the widget tree
To store build configuration settings
To access localizations strings for the current locale
To handle platform-specific code

questions.question: What is the purpose of the mounted property?
answers: To check if a widget has been initialized
To check if a widget has state
To check if a widget is visible
To check if a widget is currently in the widget tree

questions.question: Which widgets should you use to create a scrollable collection of items?
answers: Column
ListView
Stack
GridView

questions.question: When should you use the required keyword in a function parameter list?
answers: For positional non-nullable parameters
For named non-nullable parameters with a default value
For named non-nullable parameters without a default value
For constant parameters

questions.question: Which of the following statements are true about StatelessWidget and StatefulWidget?
answers: StatelessWidget doesn't have a setState method
StatefulWidget rebuilds itself and all descendant widgets when its state changes
StatefulWidget holds mutable state within its State object
StatelessWidget only ever rebuilds when its parent is rebuilt

questions.question: What is the purpose of the didUpdateWidget() method?
answers: To initialize the widget
To respond to widget configuration changes
To rebuild the widget
To dispose of resources

questions.question: What is the purpose of the analysis_options.yaml file?
answers: To define the code generation order
To enable/disable linter rules
To enable experimental analyzer plugins
To define the packages used in the project

questions.question: What is the difference between debugPrint() and print()?
answers: print is only available in debug mode
debugPrint is only available in release mode
debugPrint throttles output to prevent lag
There is no difference
